2025-10-09.content:
The query builder in the Log Analytics page is
[generally available](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) (GA). For more
information, see [Build, edit, and run a query](https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/analyze/query-and-view#query-builder).

summary.title: Query builder is now generally available
summary.summary: The query builder in the Log Analytics page is now generally available. You can use it to build, edit, and run queries.

2025-09-22.content: Cloud Logging has removed the quota for write requests per minute, which has been replaced by volume-based regional quotas. We've also removed the references to August dates for the removal of the old quota from the public documentation. For more information, see [Logging API quotas and limits](https://cloud.google.com/logging/quotas#api-limits).

summary.title: Cloud Logging Quotas Updated
summary.summary: The previous per-minute write request quota in Cloud Logging has been replaced by volume-based regional quotas. Documentation references to old quota removal dates have also been updated.

2025-09-15.content:
### Java

#### [3.23.4](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/compare/v3.23.3...v3.23.4) (2025-09-11)

##### Bug Fixes

* **deps:** Update the Java code generator (gapic-generator-java) to 2.62.1 ([1438bff](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/commit/1438bff5bc7028fbf125895f0bdd2bb50490effa))

##### Dependencies

* Update dependency com.google.cloud:sdk-platform-java-config to v3.52.1 ([#1853](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/issues/1853)) ([c21a635](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/commit/c21a635f054b1cd8a6e5aea7450017af85ba03c7))
* Update googleapis/sdk-platform-java action to v2.62.1 ([#1855](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/issues/1855)) ([b6ce498](https://github.com/googleapis/java-logging/commit/b6ce4988391dba73e019aa9f597ce6cc23f81a8c))

summary.title: New Java Library Version Released
summary.summary: A new version of the Java library has been released, including dependency updates and bug fixes.

2025-09-08.content:
### Node.js

#### [11.2.1](https://github.com/googleapis/nodejs-logging/compare/v11.2.0...v11.2.1) (2025-09-03)

##### Bug Fixes

* **logging:** Specifying resourceNames should fetch logs only from those resources ([#1597](https://github.com/googleapis/nodejs-logging/issues/1597)) ([ff7899f](https://github.com/googleapis/nodejs-logging/commit/ff7899f5e91da6540d3f68476b2d9acd58ff0993))

summary.title: Node.js Logging Library Update
summary.summary: A new version of the Node.js Logging library is available. This update fixes a bug related to specifying resourceNames, ensuring logs are fetched only from the designated resources.

You can now build queries without manually writing SQL in the Log Analytics page by using the query builder. This feature is in Public Preview. For more information, see [Build and run a SQL query](https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/analyze/query-and-view#query-builder).

summary.title: Query Builder for Log Analytics
summary.summary: You can now build queries without manually writing SQL in the Log Analytics page by using the query builder.

summary.title: Java client library for Cloud Logging updated

2025-06-06.content: Cloud Logging begins enforcement of the new volume-based regional quotas. For more information, see [Logging API quotas and limits](https://cloud.google.com/logging/quotas#api-limits).

summary.title: Cloud Logging Enforces New Volume-Based Quotas
summary.summary: Cloud Logging will start enforcing new regional quotas based on volume. For more details, please refer to the Logging API quotas and limits documentation.

2025-06-04.content: You can now cancel a running query in the Logs Explorer by clicking the **Stop query** button.

summary.title: Stop query button in Logs Explorer
summary.summary: You can now cancel a running query in the Logs Explorer by clicking the "Stop query" button.

2025-05-29.content: You can now configure the observability scope or set the default log scope by using the Google Cloud CLI. You must use version 254.0 or higher. For more information, see [Configure observability scopes](https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/scopes/configure) and [Set the default log scope](https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/log-scope/create-and-manage#set-default).

summary.title: Google Cloud CLI now supports observability and log scopes
summary.summary: You can now set the default log scope or configure the observability scope using the Google Cloud CLI with version 254.0 or higher. For more details, refer to the documentation on configuring observability scopes and setting the default log scope.
